item.title: API Findings.
People Driven Feedback.
Perception Notes.

item.description: RAW NOTES API Findings documentation just isn’t there as far as how you use the auth codes properly and how you glean the data necessary closest thing is this: https://totalexpert.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DEV/pages/669450241/Blend but it’s more of a list of things for someone who maintains the platform to know/do, than it is a guide understanding of the IT admins type of consumer, is not being translated justifications aren’t needed as much when the visuals match, so when a platform has a developer platform that looks like it’s more marketing intensive than developer intensive, it makes more sense naturally that your developers utilizing the platform are not these high-level C programmers, and the questions about “security” are not as present or difficult to explain/justify, as our clients are a little more aware there are semi-standard definitions regarding the data going directly through the APIs, BUT there’s nothing really there for deep definitions of the standards of what we can “sell” via marketing and advertising/sales we need a resource too that says here’s what your value might be in your platform, and here’s how that value maps over to us (that way it’s more possible they could build integrations themselves), as like a value:key pairing (also would be good if I wanted to help build that or someone else who doesn’t have that background in our API and doesn’t have time to build it) would help information silos in the event someone leaves as well People Findings they want something they can use, that integrates with the development more closely, else they feel like they have to hire their own SMEs in API integrations, with development backgrounds, so they can be given the correct information they are annoyed by the lack of transparency when it comes to expressing to clients what can be done and what can’t be done with the APIs and what integrations might be more difficult for us than others (when it’s assumed from their end, all integrations are easy peasy) roadmaps might be helpful, decision trees, etc.
